alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 1:00PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A low pressure system has brought heavy rain that has created localized flooding of area roadways. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Monterey County, specifically the city of Chualar. * WHEN...Until 200 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1258 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chualar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
